results.title: P E: Lever to learning
results.brief_description: Demonstrates a revolutionary system in which physical activities are used to stimulate both physical fitness ad intellectual interest in the mentally retarded. Uses Equipment such as logs, old tyres, boards, ladders and folding chairs.

results.title: P-N Junction (Episode 3)
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how the creation of single crystals, contains N-Zones and P-Zones leads to the formation of two layer in which the ionic charges are not neutralised. From the Semiconductor physics series, Part 3.

results.title: Oz: A Rock 'n' Roll Road Movie
results.creator_credit: Count Features, Chris Lofven and Lyne Helms
results.brief_description: An Australian rock movie fable. Dorothy’s teenage quest in the Australia of the 70’s is a modern parable set to Ross Wilson’s music. With three weird friends who alternate between being pals and making passes, Dorothy sets out to find the answer to fame and fortune’s riddle at the hands of the wonderful wizard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Count Features, Chris Lofven and Lyne Helms

results.title: Oz shorts. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Film Victoria, Motion Art, Angara, AFTRS, Australian Film Commission, Puppet Company, Hellhole, Much Ado, Roslyn Walker, Alison Wotherspoon, Anne Pratten, Stuart McDonald, Anna Johnson and Michael Bates
results.brief_description: The second part of an innovative and dazzling selection of Australian short films from the 1990s. The films are: “Mr. Electric” (Dir: Stuart McDonald) - in 1953 an Aboriginal man (Ernie Dingo) returns to the country home of his adopted white family to give them the gift of electricity; “Rhino” (Anna Johnson) - a kinetic black and white film combining animation and live action; “Terra Nullius” (Anne Pratten) - a confronting and disturbing film about a young Aboriginal woman dealing with her history as a survivor of incest by her adopted father; “A Passion Play” (Tony Twigg) - a haunting animated film that utilises symbols and paintings to reflect on the nature of communication; “Secrets of the City” (Cathy Linsley) - an animated dream; “Etcetera in Paper Jam” (Michael Bates) - a hilarious short about a photo- copier that turns on humans. Anyone who has worked in an office environment will enjoy this witty attack on “office culture”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Victoria, Motion Art, Angara, AFTRS, Australian Film Commission, Puppet Company, Hellhole, Much Ado, Roslyn Walker, Alison Wotherspoon, Anne Pratten, Stuart McDonald, Anna Johnson and Michael Bates

results.title: Oz shorts. Part 1
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Arcadia Pictures, Australian Film Commission, NRG Films Australia, Puss Puss Productions,, Sophie Jackson, Jo Bell, Bernard Purcell, Robert Herbert, Catherine Birmingham and Roland Gallois
results.brief_description: A wonderful compilation of Australian short films from the early 1990’s. The films are: “He and She” (Dir: R. Herbert) - a bickering couple get picked up by the police; “Drive” (C. Birmingham) - a mother and son take to the road after killing the “old man”; “Lullabies” (R. Gallois) - a gut-wrenching experimental film on the trauma of a dissolving relationship; “Just Desserts” (M. Pellizzari) - a delicious comedy about an Italo-Australian girl’s sexual awakening and her love for her mama’s cooking; “Excursion to the Bridge of Friendship” (C. Andreef) - a sophisticated Sydney woman decides to invite her folk-singing Bulgarian cousin to Australia. A very funny “silent” film about culture clash.

results.title: Oz animation: the new wave
results.creator_credit: Ronin Films and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Considered by some to be the most talented Australian New Wave animators of the late 1980’s-early 90’s, this back to back compilation showcases many incredible techniques and creative minds by these filmmakers.

results.title: Oyster man
results.creator_credit: Michael Spencer, ONF | NFB, Julian Biggs and Jean Palardy
results.brief_description: The story of oyster farming in the Gulf of St. Lawrence, showing the various stages of oyster cultivation: the sampling of minute larvae by Department of Fisheries biologists, the staking of oyster beds by farmers, the nurturing of spat, and underwater scenes showing the dragging of the sea bed with cotton mops to ensnare starfish which prey upon the oyster. Final sequences show the grading and shipping of oysters and their arrival at the sea food restaurant or family dinner table, where they delight the eyes and palates of oyster lovers.

results.title: Oxygen: an introduction to chemistry
results.creator_credit: Hans Halberstadt, Barr Films and Jim Callner
results.brief_description: Explores the nature of oxygen. Shows that oxygen has three forms: solid, liquid and gas, and that when it combines with other atoms it forms new chemical compounds. Illustrates how animals use oxygen to release energy for activity and how plants use carbon dioxide to produce oxygen.
